subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit-JPA (Hibernate) - Spring - Struts2 testing howto
msgSnippet: Try this: Right-click on the project in eclipse. Choose properties Choose java buildpath Choose libraries * add any jars that you need there. If you are using
messageBody:
Try this:
Right-click on the project in eclipse.
Choose properties
Choose java buildpath
Choose libraries
* add any jars that you need there. If you are using maven I find it
helpful to add the jars using "add variable", Configure a variable called
MAVEN_REPO (or whatever you fancy). As soon as you have that variable you
can click on it and press the extend... button and browse to the library you
want relative to the variable. This is very nice to have in a multi
developer situation since the mvn-repo may be in different locations for
different developers and all each developer needs to do is to configure
their own MAVEN_REPO variable.

Finally, go to the tab "order and export". In this tab you can change the
order of your Classpath. Make sure that the JPA-api is suficiently high in
that list. That should do it.

The above should resolve the issue (you might need to remove your launches
for your new settings to be propagated there)

But it should also do the trick just to change which JRE you launch with
(either configure it globally or locally in the project-properties). Did you
try that?

I hope this helps, hunting classpath-issues can really be frustrating. My
sympathies.
/J
